issues_found.title: [Moore] Assertion failure when module has string type output port
issues_found.analysis:
This issue is virtually identical to the crash being analyzed. Both involve:
1. Moore dialect string type in output port
2. Missing type conversion rule causing null type
3. Crash in SVModuleOpConversion::matchAndRewrite
4. Same assertion failure: 'dyn_cast on a non-existent value'
5. Same affected components and crash location (PortImplementation.h:177)
6. Both use same test case: 'module test_module(output string a);'

This appears to be an EXACT DUPLICATE of the current crash.

issues_found.title: [Moore] Assertion in MooreToCore when module uses packed union type as port
issues_found.analysis:
This issue shares the same root cause mechanism as the string port crash:
1. Both involve MooreToCore conversion pass
2. Both have missing type conversion rules (string vs packed union)
3. Both trigger same assertion: 'dyn_cast on a non-existent value'
4. Same affected components: SVModuleOpConversion, getModulePortInfo, TypeConverter
5. Same crash location: PortImplementation.h (getModulePortInfo line 259)

However, they differ in:
- Trigger type: packed union type instead of string type
- Test construct: union typedef vs simple string port

This is a RELATED ISSUE with the same root cause pattern (missing type conversion rules for unsupported types).

report_action: DO NOT CREATE NEW ISSUE - Issue #9572 is an exact duplicate of the crash being analyzed. The issue was created on 2026-02-01T03:00:12Z and contains virtually identical crash information, test case, and analysis.
cross_check_notes: Both issues report the same crash in the same components
Both have identical test cases for the string port scenario
Both trace the crash to PortImplementation.h:177 in sanitizeInOut()
Both identify the same root cause: missing string type conversion in MooreToCore
Issue #9570 (union type) demonstrates this is a systemic issue with missing type conversion rules
